com.ibm.team.repository.client

Interface IContentManager


  • public interface IContentManager
    Methods for storing and retrieving contents from the repository. The content manager is closely tied to its ITeamRepository, and only works when the client is logged in to the repository.

    Items can have content attributes (e.g. attributes that store large amounts of data) by specifying of type of the attribute as IContent. The content is then stored in the repository in a two-stage process.

    • Stage 1: upload the content bytes using storeContent(String, String, InputStream, IProgressMonitor). Upon successful receiving and storing the uploaded content, the server sends back the content description that contains among other things the UUID it has has assigned to it. The server puts the content on a pending list until it is claimed.
    • Stage 2: store the item state embedding the reference to the content by id. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content service does not have it. 
         IContent content = teamRepository.contentManager().storeContent(
                new ByteArrayInputStream(FILE_CONTENT.getBytes()));

 IChangeSetHandle cs1 = workspaceConnection.createChangeSet();
 fsv.createFile(cs1, componentRoot, "/a.txt", content, false, new Date());
        • Stage 1: fetch the item with the content attribute and retrieve the IContent instance from the item. This content description contains the identifier that can be used by the server to identify the contents associated with this attribute.
        • Stage 2: download the contents using retrieveContent(IContent, OutputStream, IProgressMonitor) using the content description from stage 1. 
         IFileItemHandle fileItemHandle = fsv.locate(componentRoot, "/a.txt");
 IFileItem fileItem = (IFileItem) workspaceConnection.configuration()
                .fetchCompleteItem(fileItemHandle, null);

 IContent content = fileItem.getContent();
 ByteArrayOutputStream byteStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
 teamRepository.contentManager().retrieveContent(content, byteStream);

        Team repository objects are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on ITeamRepository and its various subsidiaries, can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

    Since:
    0.5
    See Also:
    IContent

    • Method Detail

      • teamRepository

        ITeamRepository teamRepository()
        Returns the repository associated with this manager. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Returns:
        the repository, which is never null
        See Also:
        ITeamRepository.contentManager()

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.lang.String contentType,
                    java.lang.String characterEncoding,
                    java.io.InputStream inStream,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. use #storeContent(String, String, int, InputStream, UUID, IProgressMonitor)
        Uploads the contents to the server. The client should close this stream at their earliest convenience to free up any associated operating system resources. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg")
        characterEncoding - the character encoding of the bytes being sent, the format is specific in IContent.getCharacterEncoding() This value is used by the HTTP server; it is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior.
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Must not be null. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the content identifier for the uploaded bytes
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.lang.String contentType,
                    java.lang.String characterEncoding,
                    LineDelimiter lineDelimiter,
                    java.io.InputStream inStream,
                    UUID predecessorId,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Uploads the contents to the server. The client should close this stream at their earliest convenience to free up any associated operating system resources. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg")
        characterEncoding - the character encoding of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getCharacterEncoding() This value is used by the HTTP server; it is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. The character encoding is used when performing validation/translation of line endings, so it should be an encoding available on the server. It does not need to be supplied when storing binary data (i.e. LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE).
        lineDelimiter - the line delimiter preferred when content is retrieved. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE no conversion is done on line delimiters (i.e. treat as binary data). With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CR, LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF, LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_LF the content later retrieved will always have the line delimiter setting. The stream supplied does not have to have same the line delimiter specified but it must have consistent line delimiters (that is if LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF is specified the stream can contain line feeds, but only line feeds as line delimiters. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_PLATFORM the content when retrieved will have the line delimiter preferred by the platform (for example: Carriage return/linefeed on Windows platforms). The stream supplied must have consistent line delimiters.
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Must not be null. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception. If the line delimiter is something other than LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE the line delimiters within the stream must be consistent.
        predecessorId - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown. The predecessor must be owned by the same item that will eventually own the returned content. Additionally it must be null if the returned content will be owned by a SimpleItem.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the content identifier for the uploaded bytes
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.lang.String contentType,
                    java.lang.String characterEncoding,
                    LineDelimiter lineDelimiter,
                    IContentManagerInputStreamProvider streamProvider,
                    UUID predecessorId,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Uploads the contents to the server. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg")
        characterEncoding - the character encoding of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getCharacterEncoding() This value is used by the HTTP server; it is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. The character encoding is used when performing validation/translation of line endings, so it should be an encoding available on the server. It does not need to be supplied when storing binary data (i.e. LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE).
        lineDelimiter - the line delimiter preferred when content is retrieved. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE no conversion is done on line delimiters (i.e. treat as binary data). With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CR, LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF, LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_LF the content later retrieved will always have the line delimiter setting. The stream supplied does not have to have same the line delimiter specified but it must have consistent line delimiters (that is if LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF is specified the stream can contain line feeds, but only line feeds as line delimiters. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_PLATFORM the content when retrieved will have the line delimiter preferred by the platform (for example: Carriage return/linefeed on Windows platforms). The stream supplied must have consistent line delimiters.
        streamProvider - the input stream provider from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Must not be null. If the line delimiter is something other than LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE the line delimiters within the stream must be consistent.
        predecessorId - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown. The predecessor must be owned by the same item that will eventually own the returned content. Additionally it must be null if the returned content will be owned by a SimpleItem.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the content identifier for the uploaded bytes
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.lang.String contentType,
                    java.lang.String characterEncoding,
                    java.io.InputStream inStream,
                    long length,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. use #storeContent(String, String, int, InputStream, long, UUID, IProgressMonitor)
        Uploads the contents to the server. The client should close this stream at their earliest convenience to free up any associated operating system resources. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg")
        characterEncoding - the character encoding of the bytes being sent, the format is specific in IContent.getCharacterEncoding(). This value is used by the HTTP server; it is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior.
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception.
        length - the length of the content in bytes
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the content identifier for the uploaded bytes
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.lang.String contentType,
                    java.lang.String characterEncoding,
                    java.io.InputStream inStream,
                    UUID predecessorId,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. use #storeContent(String, String, int, InputStream, UUID, IProgressMonitor)
        Uploads the contents to the server. The client should close this stream at their earliest convenience to free up any associated operating system resources. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, if content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg", line-ending normalization may be performed on the file, which will corrupt an image file.)
        characterEncoding - the character encoding of the bytes being sent, the format is specific in IContent.getCharacterEncoding() This value is used by the HTTP server; it is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior.
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Must not be null. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception.
        predecessorId - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown. The predecessor must be owned by the same item that will eventually own the returned content. Additionally it must be null if the returned content will be owned by a SimpleItem.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the content identifier for the uploaded bytes
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

        Uploads the contents to the server. The client should close this stream at their earliest convenience to free up any associated operating system resources. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, if content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg", line-ending normalization may be performed on the file, which will corrupt an image file.)
        characterEncoding - the character encoding of the bytes being sent, the format is specific in IContent.getCharacterEncoding(). This value is used by the HTTP server; it is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior.
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception.

        predecessorId - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown. The predecessor must be owned by the same item that will eventually own the returned content. Additionally it must be null if the returned content will be owned by a SimpleItem.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.lang.String contentType,
                    java.lang.String characterEncoding,
                    LineDelimiter lineDelimiter,
                    java.io.InputStream inStream,
                    long length,
                    UUID predecessorId,
                    com.ibm.team.repository.common.utils.HashCode contentHashCode,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Use #storeContent(String, String, int, InputStream, UUID, IProgressMonitor) as in most cases the hash code is not known and conversion has to be done for the line delimiters. This method is a little more efficient than the other one when the hashcode is already known and the line delimiter is LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE Uploads the contents to the server. The client should close this stream at their earliest convenience to free up any associated operating system resources. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg")
        characterEncoding - the character encoding of the bytes being sent, the format is specific in IContent.getCharacterEncoding(). This value is used by the HTTP server; it is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior.
        lineDelimiter - the line delimiter preferred when content is retrieved. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE no conversion is done on line delimiters. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CR, LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF, LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_LF the content later retrieved will always have the line delimiter setting. The stream supplied does not have to have same the line delimiter specified but it must have consistent line delimiters (that is if LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF is specified the stream can contain line feeds, but only line feeds as line delimiters. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_PLATFORM the content when retrieved will have the line delimiter preferred by the platform (for example: Carriage return/linefeed on Windows platforms). The stream supplied must have consistent line delimiters.
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception. If the line delimiter is something other than LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE the line delimiters within the stream must be consistent.
        length - the length of the content in bytes
        predecessorId - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown. The predecessor must be owned by the same item that will eventually own the returned content. Additionally it must be null if the returned content will be owned by a SimpleItem.
        contentHashCode - The hash code of the content. It must match that of the content after all conversion has been done.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the content identifier for the uploaded bytes
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.io.InputStream inStream,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. use storeContent(InputStream, UUID, IProgressMonitor);
        Uploads the contents to the server. The content type will be auto detected. The characterEncoding will default to "us-ascii". Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        The information about the content stored on the server, which is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.lang.String contentType,
                    java.lang.String content,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Uploads the contents to the server. The string will be encoded with a character encoding that can encode all the characters in the string. Line delimiters in the string will be treated as if LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE was used. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the string being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, if content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg", line-ending normalization may be performed on the file, which will corrupt an image file.)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        The information about the content stored on the server, which is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.io.InputStream inStream,
                    UUID predecessorId,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. use #storeContent(String, String, int, InputStream, UUID, IProgressMonitor)
        Uploads the contents to the server. The content type will be auto detected. The characterEncoding will default to "us-ascii". Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception.
        predecessorId - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown. The predecessor must be owned by the same item that will eventually own the returned content. Additionally it must be null if the returned content will be owned by a SimpleItem.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        The information about the content stored on the server, which is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

        IContent storeContent(java.io.InputStream inStream,
                    long length,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. use storeContent(InputStream, long, UUID, IProgressMonitor)
        Uploads the contents to the server. The content type will be auto detected. The characterEncoding will default to "us-ascii". Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. The input stream will be closed on return from this method, whether normal or exception.
        length - the length of the input stream in bytes. If this is incorrect, it will result in either an exception being thrown (if the specified length is longer that the actual stream length), or data truncation (if the specified length is shorter that the actual stream length.)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        The information about the content stored on the server, which is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeText

        IContent storeText(java.lang.String mediaType,
                 java.lang.String inputStreamCharacterEncoding,
                 LineDelimiter lineDelimiter,
                 java.io.InputStream inStream,
                 UUID predecessorId,
                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                   throws TeamRepositoryException
        Uploads the contents to the server. The text content will be converted from the specified encoding to an encoding that is supported across multiple platforms (UTF-8). This method should not be used if the text content is self describes it's encoding (because the encoding might change during storage). Files that contain their encoding should be stored using the binary storage APIs.
        Parameters:
        mediaType - the media type of the bytes being sent, the format is specified in IContent.getContentType(). The content type is not verified, and providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior. (For example, content type "text/plain" is specified for a file that should be "image/jpeg")
        inputStreamCharacterEncoding - the character encoding of the input stream. Providing an incorrect value for this may result in uncaught incorrect behavior.
        lineDelimiter - the line delimiter preferred when content is retrieved. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE no conversion is done on line delimiters. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CR, LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF, LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_LF the content later retrieved will always have the line delimiter setting. The stream supplied does not have to have same the line delimiter specified but it must have consistent line delimiters (that is if LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF is specified the stream can contain line feeds, but only line feeds as line delimiters. With LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_PLATFORM the content when retrieved will have the line delimiter preferred by the platform (for example: Carriage return/linefeed on Windows platforms). The stream supplied must have consistent line delimiters.
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Will be closed on method return whether normal or exception. If the line delimiter is something other than LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE the line delimiters within the stream must be consistent.
        predecessorId - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown. The predecessor must be owned by the same item that will eventually own the returned content. Additionally it must be null if the returned content will be owned by a SimpleItem.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        The information about the content stored on the server, which is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • storeContent

                    long length,
                    UUID predecessorId,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. use #storeContent(String, String, int, InputStream, long, UUID, IProgressMonitor)

Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.ITeamRepository#save(IAuditable) or com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operations fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        inStream - the input stream from which to read the bytes to send to the server. The input stream will be closed on return from this method, whether normal or exception.
        length - the length of the input stream in bytes. If this is incorrect, it will result in either an exception being thrown (if the specified length is longer that the actual stream length), or data truncation (if the specified length is shorter that the actual stream length.)
        predecessorId - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown. The predecessor must be owned by the same item that will eventually own the returned content. Additionally it must be null if the returned content will be owned by a SimpleItem.

      • retrieveContent

        void retrieveContent(IContent content,
                   java.io.OutputStream outStream,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Downloads the bytes specified by the content handle and writes them to the specified output stream. The output stream is closed before the method returns. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference.

        Since the content length is supplied by the server, a TeamRepositoryException will thrown if both length values do not match. A checksum mismatch will also result in a TeamRepositoryException. Since a mismatch in the content type should result in a checksum mismatch, a TeamRepositoryException will be thrown.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        content - the content that identified the bytes to download. The content object must be exactly as retrieved from the server, and must not have been modified. Modification of any fields of an IContent object before retrieving the content stream may result in unpredictable behavior.
        outStream - the output stream into which the downloaded bytes are written; this stream will be closed on any return from this method, normal or exception.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • retrieveContentStream

        java.io.InputStream retrieveContentStream(IContent content,
                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Sets up a download connection to the server to retrieve the content bytes, and returns an input stream to be used to read the content. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference.

        This method should be used with caution by client code. An HTTP connection remains open to the server until the client closes the returned input stream. Clients calling this method should immediately retrieve all content from the stream, and close it as quickly as possible.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        content - the content that identified the bytes to download. The content object must be exactly as retrieved from the server, and must not have been modified. Modification of any fields of an IContent object before retrieving the content stream may result in unpredictable behavior.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an input stream from which the content bytes can be read by client code.
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • retrieveContentStream

        java.io.InputStream retrieveContentStream(IContent content,
                                        java.lang.String alternativeEncoding,
                                        LineDelimiter alternativeDelimiter,
                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Sets up a download connection to the server to retrieve the content bytes, and returns an input stream to be used to read the content. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference.

        This method should be used with caution by client code. An HTTP connection remains open to the server until the client closes the returned input stream. Clients calling this method should immediately retrieve all content from the stream, and close it as quickly as possible.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        content - the content that identified the bytes to download. The content object must be exactly as retrieved from the server, and must not have been modified. Modification of any fields of an IContent object before retrieving the content stream may result in unpredictable behavior.
        alternativeEncoding - The character encoding to use when reading the input stream if performing any line delimiter conversion. An encoding is not required if the alternativeDelimiter is LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE The caller may choose to supply IContent.getCharacterEncoding() if there is no need to override. If the original content had a line delimiter LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_NONE, the content may not have an encoding though. The content is not converted from one encoding to another, it is an override. Incompatible specification may result in corrupt content returned.
        alternativeDelimiter - The preferred delimiter of the InputStream. This will force the content retrieved to have the line delimiter specified irregardless of the setting specified by content and whether the line delimiters are consistent. That is a binary file could be retrieved with a line delimiter of LineDelimiter.LINE_DELIMITER_LF
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an input stream from which the content bytes can be read by client code.
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • areContentBytesIdentical

        boolean areContentBytesIdentical(IContent content1,
                               IContent content2,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Are the content bytes referenced by two content objects identical?
        Parameters:
        content1 - the first content
        content2 - the second content
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        true if identical, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason

      • createSession

        IContentManagerSession createSession(int threads,
                                   java.lang.String sessionName,
                                   long transfers,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
        Deprecated. use createSession(int, boolean, String, long, IProgressMonitor)
        Creates a content transfer session for asynchronous operation. The returned object allows the caller to perform content transfer on threads other than the caller.
        Parameters:
        threads - the number of threads that should be made available for content transfers. If 0 threads are specified, then transfers will be performed in the thread that makes calls to the returned object. If 1 or more threads are specified, threads will be spawned as need be.
        sessionName - The name of the session. Passed to IProgressMonitor.beginTask(String, int).
        transfers - The number of contents to be transferred. May be IProgressMonitor.UNKNOWN if the transfer size is unknown.
        monitor - the progress monitor that tracks how far along the session is in its set of aggregated downloads.

      • createSession

        IContentManagerSession createSession(int threads,
                                   boolean allowFailures,
                                   java.lang.String sessionName,
                                   long transfers,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
        Creates a content transfer session for asynchronous operation. The returned object allows the caller to perform content transfer on threads other than the caller.
        Parameters:
        threads - the number of threads that should be made available for content transfers. If 0 threads are specified, then transfers will be performed in the thread that makes calls to the returned object. If 1 or more threads are specified, threads will be spawned as need be.
        allowFailures - Whether downloads should continue with other contents when a failure has been encountered. true to continue, false end when a failure is encountered.
        sessionName - The name of the session. Passed to IProgressMonitor.beginTask(String, int).
        transfers - The number of contents to be transferred. May be IProgressMonitor.UNKNOWN if the transfer size is unknown.
        monitor - the progress monitor that tracks how far along the session is in its set of aggregated downloads.

      • createSession

        IContentManagerSession createSession(java.lang.String sessionName,
                                   long totalWork,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
        Deprecated. use createSession(String, boolean, long, IProgressMonitor)
        Identical to calling createSession(int, String, long, IProgressMonitor), but allows the receiver to choose the number of threads to spawn.

      • createSession

        IContentManagerSession createSession(java.lang.String sessionName,
                                   boolean allowFailures,
                                   long totalWork,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
        Identical to calling createSession(int, boolean, String, long, IProgressMonitor), but allows the receiver to choose the number of threads to spawn.

      • convertDelimitersDuringRetrieval

        boolean convertDelimitersDuringRetrieval(IContent content)
        When content is retrieved, it may require conversion to the platform line delimiters. If a content will be converted, then use IContent.getEstimatedConvertedLength() and recalculate the hash code.
        Returns:
        true if the content will be converted on retrieval. false the content retrieved from the repository is untouched.
